page.title: 21Bassingbourn
page.content:
Bassingbourn is reached along the A1198 with the main part of the village to the west. The countryside around Bassingbourn is farmland with footpaths across. The population of Bassingbourn is about 4000 and rising with new houses being built.

The village has a Primary school taking children between 4 and 10 years and a Secondary school educating children between 11 and 16 years. Bassingbourn has a Sports Centre and a Children’s Centre with a Preschool for 2 to 4 year olds.

Bassingbourn has a Bakers shop, a Pharmacy, a small supermarket with Post Office, a Coffee shop, hairdressers, and a garage. In Bassingbourn only The Hoops pub remains open, one other pub is boarded up. The village library is run by volunteers and opens eight and half hours a week over three days. The surgery is in Spring Lane and has expanded. There is a dentist in Brook Road. St. Peter and St. Paul Church and the United Reformed Church are still active . The community have many groups and clubs, including the Women’s Institute, Village Band, Football, Bowls and Cricket, Judo, Brownies, Over 60’s Bridge and Book Clubs.
